alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 9:05AM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River near Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and additional minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Platte River near Darr, and perhaps other locations along the river from the Dawson-Lincoln County line downstream to near Lexington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Friday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river gauge near Darr is expected to continue to remain slightly above minor flood stage for several more days to come. The stage at the gauge site is currently expected to crest around 10.7 feet Monday into Tuesday, and then begin a very gradual fall. Please note that confidence in this forecast decreases farther out in time, especially beyond the next 2 to 3 days, as factors such as additional rainfall near and upstream of the Dawson County area could alter later forecasts at least slightly. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 07/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
